value: Plate XLV from Theatrum instrumentorum et machinarum

label: Description
value: Machien for lifting ore up a mine shaft. A frame over top holding pulleys and chain. Chain winds around axel turned by man sitting in cart on the ore. Cut-away of men at work below. Description in Latin on verso of 1949-152-242.

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. George A. Kubler; 1949: acquired by Museum.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. George A. Kubler
Plate XLVI from Theatrum instrumentorum et machinarum

label: Description
value: Machine for raising water for irrigation of land from a river. Moved by water current, water wheel turns a shaft with a curved frame which pushes a pole with buckets at either end, as it revolves, up and down. Description in Latin on verso of 1949-152-243.

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. George A. Kubler; 1949: acquired by Museum.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. George A. Kubler
Plate XLVII from Theatrum instrumentorum et machinarum

label: Description
value: Machine pumping water out of a well, through a spout, left. Bottom of well interior shown below; man runs it with a lever and pendulum, left. Description in Latin on verso of 1949-152-244.

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. George A. Kubler; 1949: acquired by Museum.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. George A. Kubler
Plate XLVIII from Theatrum instrumentorum et machinarum

label: Description
value: Pump shown inside a tower, left, cut away. It works by means of a water wheel, right, cog wheels and a curved pipe which moves a piece up and down, and others in and out, to give suction. Women upper right, filling a jar. Description in Latin on verso of 1949-152-245.

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. George A. Kubler; 1949: acquired by Museum.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. George A. Kubler
Plate XLIX from Theatrum instrumentorum et machinarum

label: Description
value: Pump run by a man, upper right, moving lever to raise and lower a weight, lower left. Water running into trough below man. Bottom of well shown below. Description in Latin on verso of 1949-152-246.

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. George A. Kubler; 1949: acquired by Museum.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. George A. Kubler
Plate L from Theatrum instrumentorum et machinarum

label: Description
value: Windmill over a stream, as a pump. Round tower, sails on a vertical shaft inside open columns, turn cog, and wheels. Pipes and spouts, right center. Description in Latin on verso of 1949-152-247.

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. George A. Kubler; 1949: acquired by Museum.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. George A. Kubler
Plate LI from Theatrum instrumentorum et machinarum

label: Description
value: Fountain inside a round wind tower; the mechanical system not shown. A lobster and dolphins below, a squid above the bowl. Oval windows in the wall, and a statue above the foundtain. Piper leading into the gardens beyond. Description in Latin on verso of 1949-152-248.

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. George A. Kubler; 1949: acquired by Museum.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. George A. Kubler
Plate LII from Theatrum instrumentorum et machinarum

label: Description
value: A machine, center, spraying water on a fire, right. Women fill a large tank of water. A man puts water from that into a funnel above the machine's spout. Machine is worked by a man t urning a screw and plate in the back, center left. Description in Latin on verso of 1949-152-249.

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. George A. Kubler; 1949: acquired by Museum.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. George A. Kubler
Plate LIII from Theatrum instrumentorum et machinarum

label: Description
value: Dredging machine over a wreck, picking up bales. The machine on a framework across two barges. Turned by two men on a wheel on a top platform, raising a screw with hooks. Description in Latin on verso of 1949-152-250.

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. George A. Kubler; 1949: acquired by Museum.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. George A. Kubler
Plave LIV from Theatrum instrumentorum et machinarum

label: Description
value: A small boat left, with many anchors out, righting a ship on logs to launch it, right, by means of ropes and wheels. Crowds watch, a city beyond, upper right. Rocks, left. Description in Latin on verso of 1949-152-251.

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. George A. Kubler; 1949: acquired by Museum.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. George A. Kubler
Plate LV from Theatrum instrumentorum et machinarum

label: Description
value: Machine for lifting a small boat, right, up a cliff from the water. A crame with hooks, pulleys, and rope. One man winding the rope, and two ready to swing the crane, left. Description in Latin on verso of 1949-152-252.

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. George A. Kubler; 1949: acquired by Museum.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. George A. Kubler
Plave LVI from Theatrum instrumentorum et machinarum

label: Description
value: Machien for lifting a ship out of the water, right, over a wall. A frame, crane and pipe; grapples on the ship's mast, one man, left controlling it. Castles, beyond, also a town. Description in Latin on verso of 1949-152-253.

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. George A. Kubler; 1949: acquired by Museum.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. George A. Kubler
Plate LVII from Theatrum instrumentorum et machinarum

label: Description
value: Two covered ships; one run by a water wheel, above, resembles a kayak with a box on it. Below, a boat with many covered decks; an eagle on the prow, right. Description in Latin on verso of 1949-152-254.

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. George A. Kubler; 1949: acquired by Museum.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. George A. Kubler
Plave LVIII from Theatrum instrumentorum et machinarum

label: Description
value: Four boats holding up four winches strapped to a latticework of poles, left, to bring up a wrecked boat beneath. Cabled to a ship, right. Description in Latin on verso of 1949-152-255.

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. George A. Kubler; 1949: acquired by Museum.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. George A. Kubler
Plate LIX from Theatrum instrumentorum et machinarum

label: Description
value: Machine of axel and screws to raise blocks of wood or marble. Two men turn the axel, lower right, and left. Indoors. Description in Latin on verso of 1949-152-256.

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. George A. Kubler; 1949: acquired by Museum.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. George A. Kubler
Plate LX from Theatrum instrumentorum et machinarum

label: Description
value: Two ships, both with double sterns, approaching a pier, left. T he cannons on the ship, center, are being fired. A pontoon on a framework rests on the pier. Description in Latin on verso of 1949-152-257.

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. George A. Kubler; 1949: acquired by Museum.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. George A. Kubler

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. George A. Kubler; 1949: acquired by Museum.
